Leonel Agüero''' ({{IPA-es|ˈseɾxjo le.oˈnel aˈɣweɾo}}; born 2 June 1988) is an Argentine professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentine national team]].
Agüero began his career at [[Club Atlético Independiente|Independiente]]. On 5 July 2003, he became the youngest player to play in the [[Argentine Primera División]] on his debut at 15 years and 35 days, breaking the record previously established by [[Diego Maradona]] in [[Seasons in Argentine football|1976]]. In 2006, he moved to Europe to play for [[La Liga]] side [[Atlético Madrid]], for a transfer fee of €23 million and made a name for himself, attracting attention from Europe's top clubs by scoring 101 goals in 234 appearances while winning the [[UEFA Europa League]] and the [[UEFA Super Cup]] in 2010.
Agüero moved to Premier League club Manchester City in July 2011 for [[List of most expensive association football transfers|an undisclosed fee thought to be in the region of £35 million]]. On the last day of his debut season with the club, he scored a 94th-minute winner against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] that earned City its first league title in 44 years. At the end of the 2015–16 season, of players who had played at least two seasons in the Premier League, Agüero had the highest goals per minute ratio in the history of the competition since its formation in 1992, averaging a goal every 106 minutes, ahead of Thierry Henry.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Best goal ratios of Premier League players |url=https://www.premierleague.com/gallery/111326 |work=Premier League |date=28 September 2016 |accessdate=10 January 2018}}</ref> He also holds the joint-record for the most goals scored in a single Premier League match – five – and the fastest to do so, in 23 minutes and 34 seconds of match time.<ref>{{cite web |title=The best Opta Stats from Saturday's Premier League games |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11661/10016044/the-best-opta-stats-from-saturdays-premier-league-games |work=Sky Sports |date=3 October 2015 |accessdate=6 October 2015}}</ref> In November 2017, Agüero became [[List of Manchester City F.C. records and statistics#All-time top goalscorers|Manchester City's all-time highest goal-scorer]], scoring his 178th City goal against [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41710035 |title=Aguero: More than just a record goalscorer |date=2 November 2017 |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=24 December 2017}}</ref> Agüero is currently the 8th highest goalscorer in Premier League history, and the highest non-European scorer in the history of the Premier League, with over [[List of Premier League players with 100 or more goals|100 goals in the division]].
At international level, Agüero represented the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina under-20 team]] at the [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship|2005]] and in [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2007]], winning both tournaments.<ref name=rise/> He played at the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2008 Beijing Olympics]], scoring two goals in the 3–0 semi-final win against [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil]] as Argentina went on to win the gold medal.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/olympics/argentina-3-brazil-0-argentina-in-final-after-routing-arch-rivals-902777.html |title=Argentina 3 Brazil 0: Argentina in final after routing arch rivals – Olympics, Sport |publisher=The Independent |date=20 August 2008 |accessdate=24 August 2011 |location=London |first1=Nick |last1=Harris}}</ref> Agüero was selected to represent Argentina in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], the [[2011 Copa América]], the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], the [[2015 Copa América]], and the [[Copa América Centenario]], reaching the finals of the latter three tournaments. He also participated in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], where he scored his first and second World Cup goals for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]].
He wears "Kun" on his shirt, a childhood nickname based on the title character from the cartoon [[Kum-Kum]].<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/sergio-aguero-on-how-kun-4501690|author=Sergio Aguero|title=Sergio Aguero on.. how he got his "Kun" nickname and what it means}}</ref><!-- note: source does not explicitly name the cartoon, but it names the character and describes the caveman setting -->
==Club career== ===Independiente=== Sergio Agüero joined the youth system of [[Club Atlético Independiente|Independiente]] at the age of nine. He started playing for the side, becoming the youngest player to debut in the division at 15 years and 35 days (on 5 July 2003 against [[Club Atlético San Lorenzo de Almagro]]), when Independiente's coach, [[Oscar Ruggeri]] sent Agüero onto the field as a substitute for [[Emanuel Benito Rivas|Emanuel Rivas]] in the 69th minute of the match.<ref name=rise>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7384547.stm |title=The Rise of Sergio Aguero |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 May 2008 |accessdate=25 March 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/deportes/23/millones/menor/edad/elpepidep/20060601elpepidep_1/Tes |title=23 millones por un menor de edad |work=El País |date=1 June 2006 |accessdate=15 May 2012 |language=Spanish |last1=Borasteros |first1=Daniel |last2=Casar |first2=Alejandro}}</ref> His performance was well received by the press.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://edant.clarin.com/diario/2003/07/06/d-06215.htm |title=San Lorenzo, de la galera |work=Clarín |date=6 July 2003 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |language=Spanish |last=Castillo |first=Hernán}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://old.ole.com.ar/diario/2003/07/06/c-585306.htm |title=Diario Deportivo Olé – Pájaro de buen Agüero |publisher=Old.ole.com.ar |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/509319-muy-frio-san-lorenzo-gano-un-clasico-pobre |title=Muy frío: San Lorenzo ganó un clásico pobre – 06.07.2003 |publisher=Lanacion.com.ar |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> Despite his early debut, he was not selected again by Ruggeri, and his replacement [[Osvaldo Sosa]], for the remainder of [[2002–03 Argentine Primera División|2002–03 season]], having made only one appearance in the [[2002–03 in Argentine football|Torneo Clausura]]. Following the arrival of coach [[Jose Omar Pastoriza]], seven months after Agüero's first match he returned to the club's first-team in 4–2 win against [[Peru|Peru's]] [[Cienciano]] during the group stages of the [[2004 Copa Libertadores]]. This meant that he also became the youngest player to participate in the [[Copa Libertadores]], a record that he held for three years.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cronica.com.mx/nota.php?id_nota=341620 |title=La Crónica de Hoy | Prematuro debut, ¿el prólogo de una gran carrera? |publisher=Cronica.com.mx |date=10 January 2008 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> One month later, Agüero again featured in a Copa Libertadores fixture against [[Ecuador|Ecuador's]] [[Club Deportivo El Nacional|El Nacional]]. On 19 June, for the first time, Agüero played a full 90-minute match for Independiente against [[Atlético de Rafaela]] during the [[2003–04 Argentine Primera División|Torneo Clausura]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.terra.com.ar/ctematicos/clausura2004/partido/2388.shtml |title=Deportes " Torneo Clausura 2004 |publisher=Terra |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Independiente in a 2–2 draw against [[Estudiantes de la Plata|Estudiantes]] on 26 November, with a 22nd minute shot from outside the penalty area.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.terra.com.ar/ctematicos/apertura2004/partido/2661.shtml |title=Deportes " Torneo Clausura 2004 |publisher=Terra |date=26 November 2004 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref name="bio">{{cite news |url=http://www.abcpedia.com/deporte/sergio-kun-aguero.html |title=Biografia (Spanish) |accessdate=20 November 2010}}</ref> Agüero became a regular in the club's first-team, being selected for the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U-20 squad]] for the [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship|2005 FIFA U-20 World Cup]], which Argentina won.
During the [[2005–06 in Argentine football|2005–06 season]], Agüero scored 18 goals in 36 league appearances, having missed two games due to suspension. In a 4–0 win against [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing]] on 11 September, he dribbled from inside of his own half and scored Independiente's fourth goal with a left footed shot.<ref name=bio /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.independiente1905.com.ar/noticias/noti_29.htm |title=Sergio Agüero, El Demonio Rojo |publisher=Independiente1905.com.ar |date=13 September 2005 |accessdate=15 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120425083032/http://www.independiente1905.com.ar/noticias/noti_29.htm |archivedate=25 April 2012}}</ref> His first red card came in the Torneo Apertura, after slapping an opponent in a match against [[Tiro Federal]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.terra.com.ar/canales/apertura05/partido/2987.shtml |title=Deportes > Torneo apertura 2005 |publisher=Terra |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> His outstanding performances during the [[2005–06 Argentine Primera División|Torneo Apertura]] attracted interest from a number of large European clubs, and, after months of speculation, Agüero announced on TV in April that he intended to leave the club at the end of the season. Before the end of the season, there had already been speculation of a possible transfer to [[Atlético Madrid]].<ref name=bio /> With his performances being lauded by the press, there was talk of a possible call up for Agüero for the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espndeportes.espn.go.com/news/story?id=427233 |title=Suma goles, suma apoyo popular – Mundial2006 – ESPN Deportes |publisher=Espndeportes.espn.go.com |date=1 January 2008 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://espndeportes.espn.go.com/news/story?id=443923 |title=Tres nombres que no hubieran faltado – Mundial2006 – ESPN Deportes |publisher=Espndeportes.espn.go.com |date=1 January 2008 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/788856-aguero-todos-piden-por-el |title=Agüero: todos piden por él – 15.03.2006 |publisher=Lanacion.com.ar |date=15 March 2006 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> In a 2–0 away victory against [[Olimpo de Bahia Blanca]] in round 17 of the Torneo Clausura, Agüero received his fifth yellow card of the season. This prevented him from playing his last game for Independiente in a fixture against [[Boca Juniors]] in [[Avellaneda]] one week later. The yellow card brought tears to his eyes, as television cameras recorded.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.terra.com.ar/canales/clausura06/partido/3356.shtml |title=Deportes > Torneo Clausura 2006 |publisher=Terra |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> Agüero, who scored Independiente's second goal of the match later said "I think that it was my last goal for Independiente". He played his last game for Independiente, two weeks later, in a 2–0 away defeat to [[Rosario Central]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.terra.com.ar/canales/clausura06/partido/3376.shtml |title=Deportes > Torneo Clausura 2006 |publisher=Terra |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> On 30 May, Agüero officially transferred to Atlético Madrid for €20 million, marking a record for the club.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/notas/352663.html |title=Agüero, el juvenil récord del futbol argentino – El Universal – Deportes |publisher=El Universal |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref>
===Atlético Madrid=== ====2006–07 season==== [[File:SergioAgüero.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Agüero playing for Atlético Madrid in October 2007.]] In May 2006, Agüero joined Spanish club [[Atlético Madrid]] for a fee reported to be around €20 million, breaking the club's previous transfer record.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=369484&cc=5739 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |title=Atlético agree fee for Independiente starlet}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=369713&cc=4716 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |title=Atlético sign Argentine prodigy Agüero}}</ref> He caused controversy early in his Atlético career by using his hands to score the winning goal against [[Recreativo de Huelva]] on 14 October 2006, only his second goal for the club, with the first coming in a 4–1 away win against [[Athletic Bilbao]] on 17 September.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=204980&cc=null&league=ESP.1 |publisher=ESPN |title=Atlético Madrid 2–1 Recreativo Huelva}}</ref> He ended his first season in Madrid with seven goals in all competitions, eased into European football by manager [[Javier Aguirre]], who opted to bring him in and out of the line-up as Atlético finished seventh, enough to qualify for the [[UEFA Intertoto Cup]].
====2007–08 season==== Following the departure of strike partner [[Fernando Torres]] to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the summer of 2007, Agüero secured his starting spot for the ''Rojiblancos'' and soon became arguably the team's most important player at the age of just 19. In the [[2007–08 La Liga|2007–08 season]], he finished third highest scorer in [[La Liga]], behind [[Daniel Güiza]] and [[Luís Fabiano]], with 19 goals, and was runner up in the ''[[Trofeo Alfredo Di Stéfano]]'' award.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1202736803447/noticia/Noticia/Raul_wins_the_Di_Stefano_Trophy.htm |publisher=Real Madrid |title=Marca names the Madridista captain the best player of the league |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090630053840/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1202736803447/noticia/Noticia/Raul_wins_the_Di_Stefano_Trophy.htm |archivedate=30 June 2009}}</ref> Agüero won many plaudits for his [[man of the match]] display against [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in March 2008, scoring twice, assisting a goal and winning a penalty for Atlético in a 4–2 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2008/mar/03/europeanfootball.barcelona |publisher=The Guardian |title=A masterclass from Atlético Madrid's Sergio Agüero dented Barcelona's title hopes and made several Catalan headline-writers look very foolish indeed |location=London |first=Sid |last=Lowe |date=3 March 2008}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Sergio Aguero – Readers Q&A |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7384770.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=7 May 2008}}</ref> He also scored important goals against the likes of [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], [[Valencia CF|Valencia]], [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] and [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] to help Atlético finish fourth and qualify for the [[UEFA Champions League]] for the first time in over ten years.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/news/2008/May/12/atletico-de-madrid-confirm-return-to-europes-elite |title=Atletico de Madrid confirm return to Europe's elite |date=12 May 2008 |work=soccerway.com}}</ref>
====2008–09 season==== Agüero was once again a regular goalscorer for Atlético in the [[2008–09 La Liga|2008–09 season]], continuing to establish a lethal partnership with [[Uruguay]]an striker [[Diego Forlán]], also a former Independiente player. On 16 September, he scored his first Champions League goals in a 3–0 away win at [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]], helping Atlético eventually reach the last 16 of the competition.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_facts/0,19762,11065_3059895,00.html |title=PSV Eindhoven 0–3 Atlético Madrid |work=Sky Sports}}</ref> In March 2009, the duo of Forlán and Agüero scored a [[Brace (sports)#In other fields|brace]] each in a 4–3 win over league leaders Barcelona, the latter scoring the winning goal in the final minutes of the match.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/SPORT/football/03/01/spain.barcelona/index.html |publisher=CNN |title=Atletico stun Barcelona as Real close up |accessdate=7 June 2009 |date=1 March 2009}}</ref> With the help of more vital goals in a formidable end of the season run-in from his team, Agüero finished in the top ten contenders for the [[Pichichi Trophy]], which was won by his teammate Forlán.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://es.eurosport.yahoo.com/01062009/15/uruguayo-forlan-gano-pichichi-bota-oro.html |publisher=Eurosport |title=El uruguayo Forlán ganó el 'pichichi' y la 'Bota de Oro' |language=Spanish |date=1 June 2009 |accessdate=26 June 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120710234709/http://es.eurosport.yahoo.com/01062009/15/uruguayo-forlan-gano-pichichi-bota-oro.html |archivedate=10 July 2012}}</ref> Atlético finished fourth in the league, qualifying for the following season's [[2009–10 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]].
====2009–10 season==== Despite not being as prolific in front of goal, Agüero had another good season in [[2009–10 La Liga|2009–10]], and was praised for his influential performances as Atlético enjoyed their most successful season in over a decade.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/2010/04/07/futbol/equipos/atletico/1270634644.html |title=Quique Sánchez Flores and Diego Forlán prefer Sergio Agüero to Lionel Messi (Spanish) |publisher=Marca |date=7 April 2010 |accessdate=18 November 2010}}</ref> On 3 November 2009, he scored twice against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] during a 2–2 draw in the Champions League at the [[Vicente Calderón Stadium|Vicente Calderón]]. Atlético were knocked out of the competition, but went on to reach the final of the [[2009–10 UEFA Europa League]], where Agüero assisted both goals in a 2–1 [[extra time]] win against English club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://en.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000042/match=2000967/postmatch/report/index.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100514180931/http://en.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000042/match=2000967/postmatch/report/index.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=14 May 2010 |title=Forlán double gives Atlético glory |publisher=UEFA |date=12 May 2010 |accessdate=30 July 2010}}</ref> He also helped Atlético reach the final of the [[Copa del Rey]], although this time they were not victorious, losing to Sevilla in the [[Camp Nou]] on 19 May.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/european/7741630/Atletico-Madrid-0-Sevilla-2-match-report.html |title=Atlético Madrid 0–2 Sevilla – Match Report |publisher=Telegraph |date=19 May 2010 |accessdate=18 November 2010 |location=London}}</ref>
On 27 August 2010, Atlético Madrid captured the [[2010 UEFA Super Cup|UEFA Super Cup]] by beating favorites [[Inter Milan|Internazionale]] 2–0. Agüero provided the assist for [[José Antonio Reyes]]' opening goal and then secured the win by scoring the second.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2010/08/27/2090098/atletico-madrid-goal-heroes-jose-antonio-reyes-kun-aguero-praise- |title=Atletico Madrid Goal Heroes José Antonio Reyes & Kun Agüero Praise Team After Inter Win |publisher=Goal.com |date=27 August 2010 |accessdate=27 August 2010}}</ref> On 4 January 2011, Atlético Madrid confirmed via their official website that Agüero had signed a new contract with the club, keeping him at the Vicente Calderón until 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11827_6634899,00.html |title=Agüero agrees Atlético stay |publisher=Sky Sports |date=4 January 2011 |accessdate=4 January 2011}}</ref> The following day, he was named as the new [[captain (association football)|vice-captain]] of Atlético, along with strike partner Diego Forlán.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.clubatleticodemadrid.com/Web/noticia/template_noticia/noticia1.php?idnoticia=16703&previo=1 |title=Agüero named Atlético vice-captain |publisher=Atlético Madrid Official website |date=5 January 2011 |accessdate=5 January 2011}}</ref>
====2010–11 season==== [[File:Pepe y aguero.jpg|thumb|right|Agüero with Atlético Madrid during the [[2010–11 La Liga|2010–11 season]].]] The [[2010–11 La Liga|2010–11 season]] was arguably Agüero's most successful for Atlético, as he scored 20 league goals for the first time in his career. Between March and May 2011, he went on a run of seven consecutive goalscoring appearances, a feat that no other player in Europe could match during the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.twitter.com/OptaJose/statuses/66921084271869952 |title=Agüero scores in seven consecutive matches |publisher=Opta (Twitter)}}</ref> Agüero's final outing for Atlético came on 21 May against [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]], a game in which he reached two [[milestone]]s. In a 4–3 win, he scored his first career [[hat-trick]], the second goal being his 100th for the ''Colchoneros''.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/49221/mallorca-vs-atletico-madrid/report |title=RCD Mallorca 3–4 Atlético Madrid |publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> Failure to celebrate any of the goals, however, led to speculation that he would be on his way out of the club.
On 23 May 2011, Agüero announced on his official website that he wanted to move from Atlético and formally asked to be released from his contract.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whoateallthepies.tv/transfer_talk/72527/the-time-has-come-sergio-aguero-seeks-atletico-madrid-exit.html |title='The Time Has Come' – Sergio Aguero Asks Atletico Madrid to Tear Up His Contract » Who Ate all the Pies |publisher=Whoateallthepies.tv |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sergioaguero.com/notas.php?ID=298 |title=La Hora de Partir (Time to Leave) |publisher=Sergio Agüero Official website |date=23 May 2011 |accessdate=29 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110528234750/http://www.sergioaguero.com/notas.php?ID=298 |archivedate=28 May 2011}}</ref> Agüero later spoke to [[ESPN]], where he stated that he would "not be returning to Atlético".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.atleticofans.com/8365/aguero-i-will-not-be-returning-to-atletico/ |title=Agüero: "I will not be returning to Atlético" |publisher=Atleticofans.com |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> On the same day that Agüero officially became a [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] player, Atlético hosted a [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round|2011–12 Europa League qualifier]] against [[Strømsgodset IF]], where a group of Atlético fans brandished "Agüero, We Hope You Die" banners in a =====Final game of the season===== {{Quote box | width=30% | align=right| quote="In my career so far it's the most important goal. You score the goal in the last minute to win the title. I thought for all the world that [[Mario Balotelli|Mario]] [Balotelli] was going to have a go himself but he just moved it on one more and it fell at my feet and I just thought: 'Hit the target, hit it as hard as you can and hit the target.' And it went in."|source=<small>Sergio Agüero, on his [[last-minute goal]] against Queens Park Rangers in 2012 which won the Premier League for City.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Sergio Agüero predicts 'run of trophies' for champions Manchester City |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/may/14/sergio-aguero-champions-manchester-city |work=The Guardian |date=14 May 2012 |accessdate=15 May 2012 |location=London |first=Jamie |last=Jackson}}</ref></small> }}
Five straight wins helped City wipe out the eight-point deficit against United, and they went into the final day's fixtures leading on goal difference. Facing relegation-threatened [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], City needed to match or better United's result at [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]]. By the 66th minute, QPR's [[Joey Barton]] was sent off after elbowing Agüero's teammate, [[Carlos Tevez]] in the face. Eventually after being shown the red card, Barton proceeded to kick Agüero's knee, then attempted to attack [[Vincent Kompany]], only for him to be held back by Micah Richards. Despite that, QPR still went ahead 2–1 against City, while United were 1–0 up against Sunderland. In response, manager Roberto Mancini sent on strikers [[Edin Džeko]] and [[Mario Balotelli]] in an attempt to get the two goals City now needed for the title. Five minutes of injury time began for City with their and United's match scores still constant. Džeko equalised for City for a glimmer of hope, but United soon finished their own game with a victory. In the 94th minute, Agüero, receiving the ball from Balotelli, drove into the penalty area and placed a powerful low shot into the corner of the goal, clinching the win and the title for Manchester City.<ref name="BBC2012">[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17973148 "Man City snatch dramatic Premier League title win"]. BBC. Retrieved 13 May 2012</ref> Agüero's goal sent the [[City of Manchester Stadium]] into a frenzy and he was dragged to the floor jubilantly by his City teammates. [[Vincent Kompany]] recalled that Agüero was crying on the floor,<ref>{{Cite news |title='Sergio was crying': Kompany relives the moments after City's last-gasp winner |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/sergio-aguero-cried-after-title-831767 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |date=13 May 2012 |accessdate=16 May 2012}}</ref> and when asked if he cried during the Manchester City parade the following day, Agüero stated: "Yeah, a little".<ref>{{Cite news |title=Sun shines on City's victory parade |url=http://football.uk.reuters.com/leagues/premiership/news/2012/05/14/28696966-9DFA-11E1-A903-020D8033923B.php |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120913035654/http://football.uk.reuters.com/leagues/premiership/news/2012/05/14/28696966-9DFA-11E1-A903-020D8033923B.php |dead-url=yes |archive-date=13 September 2012 |work=Reuters |date=14 May 2012 |accessdate=16 May 2012}}</ref>

====2013–14 season==== [[File:Dzeko kickoff.jpg|thumb|Agüero and [[Edin Džeko]] about to kick-off against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in August 2013]] Following a knee injury that ruled him out of all of the club's pre-season games,<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/08/sergio-aguero-manchester-city |title=Sergio Agüero in frame for Manchester City opener against Newcastle |date=8 August 2013 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> Agüero scored in City's 4–0 victory over Newcastle United in the opening game of the [[2013–14 Premier League]] season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://talksport.com/football/man-city-4-0-newcastle-%E2%80%93-dream-start-pellegrini-blues-batter-ten-man-toon-13081956339 |title=Man City 4–0 Newcastle – Dream start for Pellegrini as Blues batter ten-man Toon |work=talkSPORT}}</ref> On 22 September 2013, he scored a brace in a 4–1 home win against Manchester United.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/sep/22/manchester-city-united-premier-league |title=Manchester City make easy work of lacklustre Manchester United |date=22 September 2013 |work=The Guardian}}</ref>
On 8 November 2013, after scoring five goals in four matches between 5 October and 2 November, Agüero was awarded the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for the first time. During the same period, he had also scored both goals for City in a 2–1 away win against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.mcfc.com/News/Team-news/2013/November/Sergio-Aguero-named-October-Barclays-Premier-League-Player-of-the-Month |title=Kun named league's best in October |date=8 November 2013 |accessdate=10 January 2015 |work=Manchester City Football Club}}</ref>
On 24 November, after scoring his ninth and tenth goals of the league season in a 6–0 win against Tottenham Hotspur, Agüero overtook [[Thierry Henry]] as the player with the highest goals-per-minute ratio in Premier League history.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2513150/Sergio-Aguero-deadliest-striker-Premier-League-history.html |title=Forget Henry, Van Nistelrooy, Shearer and co ... this is why Aguero is now the deadliest striker in Premier League history |date=25 November 2013 |accessdate=5 March 2014 |work=Daily Mail |location=London |first=Nik |last=Simon}}</ref> He also scored six goals in five matches in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage|Champions League group stage]] as Manchester City qualified for the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|knockout phase]] for the first time.
On 14 December 2013, Agüero was substituted in a 6–3 win against Arsenal due to a calf injury<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/dec/17/manchester-city-sergio-aguero-injury |title=Manchester City could be without injured Sergio Agüero for eight weeks |date=18 December 2013 |accessdate=5 March 2014 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> and missed eight matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1699560/manchester-city-striker-sergio-aguero-faces-month-injured?cc=3436 |title=Sergio Aguero faces month out injured |date=31 January 2014 |accessdate=5 March 2014 |work=ESPN}}</ref> On 16 January 2014, he returned from injury in an [[2013–14 FA Cup|FA Cup]] third-round replay against Blackburn Rovers, scoring after coming on as a substitute in the 5–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/15/manchester-city-blackburn-rovers-fa-cup |title=Manchester City's Álvaro Negredo inspires replay win over Blackburn |date=16 January 2014 |accessdate=5 March 2014 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> In the next round of the competition, he scored his first hat-trick of the season in a 4–2 victory over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. On 29 January, he scored his 50th Premier League goal in a 5–1 victory at Tottenham but was substituted with a hamstring injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25838298 |title=Tottenham 1–5 Man City |date=29 January 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |last=McNulty |first=Phil}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://talksport.com/football/agueros-injury-woes-continue-can-man-city-cope-without-their-star-man-14012977727 |title=Aguero's injury woes continue: Can Man City cope without their star man? |date=29 January 2014 |accessdate=5 March 2014 |work=Talksport}}</ref>
On 2 March 2014, Agüero returned to the Manchester City team for the [[2014 Football League Cup Final]], where the team beat Sunderland 3–1 at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref name="2March2014Sunderland">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26311649 |title=Man City 3–1 Sunderland |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 March 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |last=McNulty |first=Phil}}</ref> In his third appearance since returning from the hamstring problem, Agüero suffered a recurrence of the injury and was withdrawn at half-time in a 2–1 Champions League loss at [[Camp Nou]] against Barcelona.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/barclays-premier-league/story/1748558/manchester-city-sweat-on-new-sergio-aguero-injury |title=City sweat on Sergio Aguero injury |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=25 October 2015 |last=Corrigan |first=Dermot}}</ref> He missed the team's next five Premier League matches, before returning to the starting line-up in a 3–2 loss against Liverpool at [[Anfield]] on 13 April.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-v-manchester-city-sergio-aguero-returns-to-city-squad-for-crucial-premier-league-meeting-at-anfield-9254391.html |title=Liverpool v Manchester City: Sergio Aguero returns to City squad for crucial Premier League meeting at Anfield |date=11 April 2014 |accessdate=22 April 2014 |work=The Independent}}</ref>
On 21 April 2014, Agüero scored his first goal since January in a 3–1 defeat of West Bromwich Albion at the City of Manchester Stadium.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27017161 |title=Man City 3–1 West Brom |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 April 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2015}}</ref> After scoring his final goal of the season in a 3–2 win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]] on 3 May, Agüero started for Manchester City against West Ham as the team secured its second Premier League title in three seasons with a 2–0 win.<ref name="McNulty11May2014">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27273582 |title=Man City 2–0 West Ham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 May 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |last=McNulty |first=Phil}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== [[File:CSKA-MC (12).jpg|thumb|left|upright|Agüero playing against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in October 2014]] On 14 August 2014, Agüero signed a new five-year contract to keep him at Manchester City until 2019.<ref>{{cite news |title=Aguero signs new five-year contract at City |url=http://www.mcfc.com/News/Team-news/2014/August/Sergio-Aguero-signs-new-five-year-contract-at-City |publisher=Manchester City F.C. Official Website |date=14 August 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |last=Booth |first=Mark}}</ref>
Agüero scored his first goal of [[2014–15 Manchester City F.C. season|2014–15]] while appearing as an 83rd-minute substitute for Edin Džeko in City's opening match of the [[2014–15 Premier League|Premier League]] season against Newcastle on 17 August.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28730044 |title=Newcastle 0–2 Man City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj}}</ref> Due to his late return from the World Cup, Agüero was again used as a substitute in the second game of the season against Liverpool, but, after replacing Džeko, took just 23 seconds to score City's third goal in the 3–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/08/26/uk-soccer-england-idUKKBN0GP1X620140826 |title=Manchester City ominous after cruising past Liverpool |publisher=Reuters |date=26 August 2014 |accessdate=30 October 2015 |last=Reich |first=Josh}}</ref>
On 18 October 2014, he scored all four of City's goals in a 4–1 home win over Tottenham, two of which were penalties; he took another penalty in the match, but it was saved by [[Hugo Lloris]]. This took Agüero to 61 Premier League goals for the club, surpassing Carlos Tevez as the club's record scorer in the competition.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bevan |first1=Chris |title=Man City 4–1 Tottenham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29580245 |accessdate=18 October 2014 |work=BBC Sport |date=18 October 2014}}</ref> He was the first player in the season to reach ten Premier League goals, doing so with the only goal in the Manchester derby on 2 November.<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |title=Man City 1–0 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29775977 |accessdate=2 November 2014 |work=BBC Sport |date=2 November 2014}}</ref>
{{Quote box |quote = Aguero is every bit as important to them as [[Luis Suárez]] was to Liverpool last year or [[Gareth Bale]] to Tottenham Hotspur the year before. |source =— English football journalist [[Martin Samuel]] after City's win over Bayern Munich.<ref>{{cite news |last=Jenson |first=Pete |title=Sergio Aguero is still coveted by Barcelona and Real Madrid... when fit he's as good as Lionel Messi or Cristiano Ronaldo |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2850127/Sergio-Aguero-coveted-Barcelona-Real-Madrid-fit-good-Lionel-Messi-Cristiano-Ronaldo.html |accessdate=30 October 2015 |work=Daily Mail |date=26 November 2014}}</ref> |align = right |quoted = 1 | width = 33% }}
Agüero scored a [[List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks|hat-trick]] in City's 3–2 win over [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group E|group stage]] on 25 November, starting with a penalty which he won himself.<ref>{{cite news |title=Man City 3–2 Bayern Mun |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29363029 |accessdate=25 November 2014 |work=BBC Sport |date=25 November 2014}}</ref> Five days later, in his 100th Premier League match, he was wrongly booked for [[Diving (association football)|simulation]] by referee [[Mike Jones (referee)|Mike Jones]] after being fouled by [[José Fonte]] in the penalty area, although City went on to defeat Southampton 3–0.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Jurejko |first1=Jonathan |title=Southampton 0–3 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30166197 |accessdate=30 November 2014 |work=BBC Sport |date=30 November 2014}}</ref>
On 2 December, Agüero was named the [[Football Supporters' Federation|Football Supporters' Federation Player of the Year]] for 2014.<ref>{{cite web |title=Agüero scores again with FSF Player of the Year |url=http://fsf.org.uk/latest-news/view/agueero-scores-again-with-fsf-player-of-the-year-award |publisher=FSF.org.uk |accessdate=18 July 2015 |date=2 December 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11679/9589108/sergio-aguero-wins-player-of-the-year-award-in-football-supporters-federation-vote |title=Manchester City's Sergio Aguero wins Player of the Year award in Football Supporters' Federation vote |work=Sky Sports}}</ref> He was also awarded [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for November 2014, a month in which he scored three league goals and assisted two more.<ref>{{cite news |title=Alan Pardew & Sergio Aguero win Manager & Player awards |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30448255 |accessdate=13 December 2014 |work=BBC Sport |date=12 December 2014}}</ref>
Agüero sustained a knee injury in the second minute of Manchester City's 1–0 win over Everton on 6 December<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/premier-league/sergio-agueros-knee-injury-to-keep-him-out-for-4-6-weeks-man-city-boss-manuel-pellegrini-say/story-e6frf4a3-1227150686898?nk=61b9b73511bdf51eee7bf7c8f753623c |title=Home | Live Scores & Latest News |publisher=Fox Sports |date= |accessdate=4 May 2016}}</ref> and was unable to appear again for the remainder of 2014. He returned to City's matchday squad for the return fixture with Everton at Goodison Park on 10 January 2015<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/09/sergio-aguero-returns-manchester-city-everton |title=Sergio Agüero returns to Manchester City squad for Everton game |date=10 January 2015 |accessdate=10 January 2015 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> and appeared as a 67th-minute substitute in the 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30663863 |title=Everton 1–1 Man City |date=10 January 2014 |accessdate=11 January 2015 |work=BBC}}</ref> On 11 February, Agüero scored his first two goals of 2015 in a 4–1 win at Stoke City.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/2015/02/12/last-gasp-willian-strike-keeps-chelsea-clear |title=Last-gasp Willian strike keeps Chelsea in the clear |date=12 February 2015 |work=Special Broadcasting Services}}</ref> On 21 February 72 seconds into a match against Newcastle United, Agüero scored the fastest penalty kick in the Premier League since 1994.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/blog/sergio-agueros-penalty-fastest-premier-league-1994 |title=Sergio Aguero's penalty was the fastest in the Premier League since 1994 |date=21 February 2015 |work=101greatgoals.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/426942/Man-City-Newcastle-match-report |title=Citizens close gap to Chelsea |date=21 February 2015 |work=Daily Star UK}}</ref>
On 12 April, Agüero scored twice in a 4–2 Manchester derby loss to Manchester United at [[Old Trafford]]. His second goal of the match took him to 100 goals for Manchester City in all competitions.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/32238665 |title=FT: Man Utd 4–2 Man City |date=12 April 2015 |work=BBC}}</ref> On 19 April, he scored his 20th Premier League goal of the season in a 2–0 home win against West Ham United.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2015-04-20/manchester-city-closes-in-on-united-beating-west-ham/6404640 |title=Manchester City beats West Ham 2–0, Tottenham Hotspur defeats Newcastle United |date=20 April 2015 |work=Australian Broadcasting Corporation}}</ref> He passed 30 goals for the season with a hat-trick in a 6–0 win over Queens Park Rangers at the City of Manchester Stadium on 9 May, relegating the opponents.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32571671 |title=Man City 6–0 QPR |date=10 May 2015 |work=BBC}}</ref> On 24 May, in Manchester City's final match of the season against Southampton, Agüero scored his 26th league goal of the season, ending 2014–15 with the [[Premier League Golden Boot]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/my/news/manchester-city-2-southampton-0-lampard-bids-premier-league-farewell-goal |title=Manchester City 2 Southampton 0: Lampard bids Premier League farewell with goal |date=24 April 2015 |work=FourFourTwo}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== On 7 August 2015, Agüero announced he would be switching from his number 16 shirt to the number 10 shirt, previously worn by teammate [[Edin Džeko]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Sergio Aguero takes no.10 shirt for 15/16 |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2015/August/Aguero-takes-no-10-shirt-for-2015-16-shirt/1438948949 |publisher=Manchester City F.C. Official Website |accessdate=10 August 2015 |date=7 August 2015 |last=Booth |first=Mark}}</ref> Nine days later, he opened the scoring in a 3–0 home victory over reigning champions Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester City 3–0 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33839794 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2015 |last=McNulty |first=Phil}}</ref>
During City's 2–0 victory away at Everton on 23 August, Agüero halted the game after noticing that an Everton supporter was in need of emergency treatment. The striker alerted the referee and the other players and made sure that the man received attention from the medics.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/greater-manchester-news/sergio-aguero-manchester-city-fans-9920485 |first=Chris |last=Slater |title=Sergio Aguero and Manchester City fans thanked for helping Everton supporter who collapsed in stand |work=Manchester Evening News |date=24 August 2015 |accessdate=24 August 2015}}</ref> On 30 September, Agüero earned and converted a last-minute penalty to give City a 2–1 win at [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage|Champions League group stage]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Jurejko |first1=Jonathan |title=Borussia Mönchengladbach 1–2 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34394000 |accessdate=1 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 September 2015}}</ref>
On 3 October, Agüero scored five goals against Newcastle in a 6–1 comeback win, joining [[Andy Cole]], [[Alan Shearer]], [[Jermain Defoe]] and [[Dimitar Berbatov]] in scoring as many in a Premier League game.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/manchester-city/story/2645709/sergio-aguero-matches-premier-league-record-with-five-goals |title=Man City's Sergio Aguero nets five goals to match Premier League record |date=October 2015 |accessdate=3 October 2015 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> His five goals within 23 minutes of game time made it the fastest five-goal haul since the Premier League started in 1992.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sergio Aguero sets record for fastest-ever five-goal haul in Premier League |url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/manchester-city/story/2646493/sergio-aguero-sets-record-for-fastest-ever-five-goal-haul |publisher=ESPN |date=3 October 2015 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |last=Jolly |first=Richard}}</ref> Four minutes after scoring his fifth goal in the 62nd minute, Agüero was substituted by manager [[Manuel Pellegrini]], as he had been receiving treatment due to a leg injury at half time.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sergio Aguero scores five goals... and Manuel Pellegrini admits the Manchester City star played with a leg injury |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3258887/Sergio-Aguero-scores-five-Manchester-City-Manuel-Pellegrini-admits-played-hamstring-injury.html |last=Bernstein |first=Joe |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=3 October 2015 |accessdate=25 October 2015}}</ref>
On 8 October, in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2018 World Cup qualifying match]] against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]], Agüero sustained a hamstring injury early on and was carried off the pitch in tears. Agüero himself said he expected to be out for around four weeks (in which the derby against Manchester United was to be played), although several media outlets later claimed the injury would last for eight weeks.<ref>{{cite web |title=Aguero confirms he will miss Manchester derby after suffering muscle tear |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/sergio-aguero-confirms-miss-manchester-6607749 |last=Richards |first=Alex |newspaper=The Mirror |date=9 October 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Man City striker Sergio Aguero could miss eight weeks |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/10023469/manchester-city-striker-sergio-aguero-suffers-grade-two-tear |publisher=Sky Sports |date=10 October 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2015}}</ref> He returned on 21 November, scoring in a 1–4 home loss to Liverpool; this was his 85th Premier League goal, making him the top-scoring South American of all time in the division, ahead of his compatriot and former strike partner Carlos Tevez.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Darwin |first1=Stephen |title=Aguero overtakes Tevez to become highest-scoring South American in Premier League history |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1862/premier-league/2015/11/21/17564172/aguero-overtakes-tevez-to-become-highest-scoring-south |accessdate=22 November 2015 |publisher=Goal.com |date=21 November 2015}}</ref>
On 16 April 2016, Agüero scored a hat-trick in a 3–0 win at Chelsea, ending with a penalty kick. He became the third visiting player to score a Premier League hat-trick at Stamford Bridge, and the fifth player to have three 20-goal seasons in the division.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Reddy |first1=Luke |title=Chelsea 0–3 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36003978 |accessdate=16 April 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 April 2016}}</ref> Three days later, he scored his [[List of Premier League players with 100 or more goals|100th Premier League]] goal in a 1–1 draw at Newcastle. He reached the century in 147 games, second only to [[Alan Shearer]] who did so in 124.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Chick |first1=Alex |title=Sergio Aguero second-fastest to 100 PL goals, but was he offside? |url=http://au.eurosport.com/football/premier-league/2015-2016/sergio-aguero-second-fastest-to-100-pl-goals-but-was-he-offside_sto5451644/story.shtml |accessdate=19 April 2016 |publisher=Eurosport |date=19 April 2016}}</ref> The goal was also Agüero's sixth against Newcastle for the season, making his just the sixth player in the Premier League era to have scored six goals against the same club in a single campaign.<ref>{{cite news |title=Aguero hits Newcastle for six to join 100 club |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2015-16/apr/200416-matchweek34-newcastle-vs-man-city-post-match-stats.html |accessdate=20 April 2016 |publisher=Premier League |date=20 April 2016}}</ref>
Agüero ended the [[2015–16 Premier League]] season with 24 goals, one behind Golden Boot winner [[Harry Kane]] and level with [[Jamie Vardy]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12028/10283818/tottenhams-harry-kane-clinches-premier-league-golden-boot |title=Tottenham's Harry Kane clinches Premier League Golden Boot |date=15 May 2016 |work=Sky Sports}}</ref> However, with his goals coming from 30 appearances, Agüero recorded the league's best goals to minute ratio.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36081144 |title=Premier League top scorer: Harry Kane? Jamie Vardy? Sergio Aguero? |date=20 April 2016 |work=BBC}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== On 13 August 2016, Agüero scored Manchester City's first competitive goal under the management of [[Pep Guardiola]] in a 2–1 victory against Sunderland on the opening day of the [[2016–17 Premier League]] season.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/match-centre/manchester-city-vs-sunderland-live-8195652 |title=Manchester City vs Sunderland live score and goal updates |last=Welch |first=Ben |date=13 August 2016|access-date=14 August 2016}}</ref>
In a league match against West Ham on 28 August, Agüero struck opponent [[Winston Reid]] in the throat with his arm, an incident which went unpunished by the referee. Reid lost his voice with the strike, and had to be substituted. The FA gave Agüero a three-match ban for violent conduct, accusing him of behaving in an "aggressive manner that was excessive in force and brutal".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37363867 |title=Sergio Aguero: Foul on Winston Reid 'brutal and aggressive', says FA commission |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 September 2016 |accessdate=15 September 2016}}</ref>
On 5 November 2016, Agüero scored his 150th goal for Manchester City in a 1–1 draw against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] in the league.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37808310 |title=Manchester City 1–1 Middlesbrough |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 November 2016 |accessdate=5 November 2016}}</ref> Agüero was sent off in a 1–3 loss to Chelsea on 3 December for a tackle on [[David Luiz]] and was given a four-match suspension.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/12/04/sergio-aguero-suspension-is-excellent-news-for-arsenal-but-terrible-timing-for-liverpool-6300755/ |title=Sergio Aguero ban excellent news for Arsenal – but terrible timing for Liverpool |date=4 December 2016 |publisher=}}</ref>

====2017–18 season====
Having scored on Manchester City's opening fixture of the season against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on 12 August,<ref>{{cite news |last=Bevan |first=Chris |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40835422 |title=Brighton & Hove Albion 0–2 Manchester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 August 2016 |accessdate=9 September 2017}}</ref> Agüero scored his second goal of the season against Liverpool in a 5–0 win on 9 September. This was his 124th Premier League goal, and saw him overtake Trinidadian [[Dwight Yorke]] as the top-scoring non-European in the competition's history.<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41133350 |title=Manchester City 5–0 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 September 2017 |accessdate=16 February 2018}}</ref> One week later, Agüero scored his sixth Premier League hat-trick in a 6–0 win at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] to put Manchester City top of the league. On 28 September, Agüero was involved in a road accident after attending a [[Maluma (singer)|Maluma]] concert in Amsterdam, when his taxi crashed into a lamppost. He was left with a fractured rib and ruled out for two weeks.<ref>{{cite news |last=Jackson |first=Jamie |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/sep/29/sergio-aguero-manchester-city-injured-in-car-accident-say-reports |title=Sergio Agüero has no need to apologise for car accident, says Pep Guardiola |work=The Guardian |date=29 September 2017 |accessdate=16 February 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41296643 |title=Sergio Aguero: Manchester City striker is a 'legend' – Pep Guardiola |work=BBC Sport |date=16 September 2017 |accessdate=16 February 2018}}</ref>
On 21 October, Agüero scored his 177th goal for Manchester City in a 3–0 win over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], equalling the record set by [[Eric Brook]]. This was also the ''Citizens'' 11th straight win, equalling another club record.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41618798 |title='Aguero should take us all out to dinner,' jokes Guardiola after Man City defeat Burnley |author=Chris Bevan |date=21 October 2017 |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |accessdate=22 October 2017}}</ref> He scored his record 178th goal for the team on 1 November away at [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] in a Champions League group game, a 4–2 win that sent his team through to the knockout stages of the competition.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41822027 |title=Agüero breaks record as City scores four in Naples |author=Emlyn Begley |date=1 November 2017 |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |accessdate=1 November 2017}}</ref>
On 20 January, Agüero scored his second hat-trick of the season against Newcastle in a 3–1 win, his second goal being the landmark 350th goal of his career.<ref>{{cite news |last=Critchley |first=Mark |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-city-3-newcastle-united-1-match-report-goals-sergio-aguero-jacob-murphy-a8170146.html |title=Sergio Aguero hits a perfect hat-trick as Manchester City end Newcastle’s acrimonious week on a sour note |work=The Independent |date=20 January 2018 |accessdate=27 January 2018}}</ref> He was later awarded the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for January, claiming the award for the fifth time in his career.<ref name=PotmJanuary2018>{{cite news |last=Cooke |first=Richard |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/11253309/sergio-aguero-wins-premier-league-player-of-the-month-award |title=Aguero wins Player of the Month |work=Sky Sports |date=16 February 2018|access-date=16 February 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
On 10 February, Agüero scored four goals in a 5–1 [[Premier League]] home thrashing of [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], claiming his third hat-trick of the season.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Bevan |first=Chris |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42927832 |title=Manchester City 5–1 Leicester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 February 2018 |accessdate=16 February 2018}}</ref> He opened the scoring in the [[2018 EFL Cup Final]] on 25 February, by chipping [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s [[David Ospina]] in a 1vs1 situation, ultimately helping City secure a convincing 3–0 victory at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref name=EFLCupFinal2018>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43101681 |title=Arsenal 0–3 Manchester City |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 February 2018 |accessdate=25 February 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== In City's first game of the season, Agüero scored both goals in the 2–0 [[2018 FA Community Shield]] victory over Chelsea, the first goal being his 200th for the club.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bevan |first1=Chris |title=Chelsea 0–2 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44995783 |accessdate=5 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 August 2018}}</ref> On 19 August 2018, Agüero scored his 9th Premier League hat-trick in a 6–1 home victory against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]], putting him behind only [[Alan Shearer]]'s 11.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/aug/19/manchester-city-huddersfield-town-premier-league-match-report |title=Sergio Agüero hits hat-trick in Manchester City’s rout of Huddersfield |last=Jackson |first=Jamie |date=2018-08-19 |website=The Guardian|access-date=2018-08-19}}</ref> He also leapfrogged [[Robin van Persie]] to enter the league's top ten scorers of all time, and second place in foreign Premier League scorers only to [[Thierry Henry]]'s 175.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Chambers |first1=Steve |title=The amazing stats from Manchester City 6-1 win now throws down the gauntlet to Liverpool |url=https://www.thesportsman.com/articles/the-amazing-stats-from-manchester-city-6-1-win-now-throws-down-the-gauntlet-to-liverpool |accessdate=19 August 2018 |publisher=The Sportsman |date=19 August 2018}}</ref> Agüero hit the post twice in a 1–1 away draw against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/44946764 |title=Wolves vs Man City - BBC Sport |last1=Jennings |first1=Patrick |accessdate=25 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 21 September, Manchester City confirmed via their official website that Agüero had signed a new contract with the club, keeping him at the Etihad Stadium until 2021.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/september/sergio-aguero-signs-new-contract-manchester-city |title=Aguero extends City contract |publisher=Manchester City |date=21 September 2018 |accessdate=21 September 2018}}</ref> On 22 September, in his 300th appearance for Manchester City, Agüero scored the opening goal in an eventual 5–0 away win over Cardiff City.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/dcunited/aguero-marks-new-deal-with-goal-as-city-thrashes-cardiff-5-0/2018/09/22/03cb896e-be81-11e8-8243-f3ae9c99658a_story.html |title=Aguero marks new deal with goal as City thrashes Cardiff 5-0 |publisher=The Washington Post |date=22 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018}}</ref> On 4 November, Agüero scored his 150th Premier League goal in a 6–1 home win over Southampton, which was his 217th Premier League appearance; he became only the ninth player in history to achieve this landmark, and only the third player after Thierry Henry and [[Wayne Rooney]] to manage this tally with a single side. He was also the second-fastest player to reach this milestone, after Alan Shearer, who took five fewer appearances.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/nov/04/manchester-city-v-southampton-premier-league-live |title=Manchester City 6-1 Southampton |publisher=The Guardian |author1=Bryan Armen Graham |date=4 November 2018 |accessdate=4 November 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.squawka.com/en/news/how-does-sergio-aguero-compare-to-other-premier-league-legends-of-the-150-club/1066268#Q5TsZ2Ib2Rv5j2f0.97 |title=How does Sergio Aguero compare to other Premier League legends of the 150 club? |publisher=www.squawka.com |author1=Harry Edwards |date=4 November 2018 |accessdate=4 November 2018 }}</ref> On 11 November, Agüero scored the second goal in a 3–1 win against Manchester United, making him the joint highest scorer in Manchester derbies in the Premier League era, level with [[Wayne Rooney]]).<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/aguero-matches-rooneys-manchester-derby-record-as-city-star/abz6kd01k38t1v0vl1ds9fgos|title=Manchester derby: Sergio Aguero matches Wayne Rooney's record as City star scores against United once again {{!}} Goal.com|access-date=2018-11-12|language=en}}</ref> On 29 January 2019, Agüero scored within 24 seconds in an eventual 2–1 defeat at Newcastle United.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46955254|title=Newcastle United 2-1 Manchester City|date=2019-01-29|access-date=2019-02-03|language=en-G}}</ref> On 3 February, Agüero scored a hat-trick against rivals Arsenal, including one goal within 48 seconds, bringing his Premier League tally of hat-tricks to ten, in a 3–1 win at the Etihad Stadium.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/46290424|title=Man City 3-1 Arsenal - Aguero completes hat-trick|date=2019-02-03|access-date=2019-02-03|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 10 February, Agüero scored his 11th hat-trick in the Premier League, as Manchester City defeated rivals Chelsea 6–0 at home;<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47183901|title=Man City 6-0 Chelsea: Hat-trick scorer Sergio Aguero your player of the match - BBC Sport|date=10 February 2019|access-date=10 February 2019|language=en-GB}}</ref> with this feat, he equalled Alan Shearer's record of 11 in the competition.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/11633778/sergio-aguero-matches-alan-shearers-premier-league-hat-tricks-record-as-man-city-thrash-chelsea|title=Sergio Aguero matches Alan Shearer's Premier League hat-tricks record as Man City thrash Chelsea|date=10 February 2019|access-date=10 February 2019|language=en-GB}}</ref> The hat trick also saw Agüero overtake [[Tommy Johnson (footballer, born 1901)|Tommy Johnson's]] and Eric Brook's record of 158 league goals for the club, and set a new record of 160 goals.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2019/february/man-city-sergio-aguero-chelsea-league-record-hat-trick |title=Aguero sets new City record|publisher=www.mancity.com |last1=Pollard |first1=Rob |date=10 February 2019 |accessdate=10 February 2019 }}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth teams=== Agüero was selected for the [[Argentina national under-17 football team|Argentina U17]] team to participate at the [[:es:Campeonato Sudamericano Sub-16 de 2004|2004 U-16 South American Championship]] in Paraguay in September. He participated in all of Argentina's group stage matches, scoring in a 2–1 win against the [[United States men's national under-17 soccer team|United States]] and a 3–1 win against [[Ecuador national under-17 football team|Ecuador]] to help Argentina finish top of their group. Agüero scored in the 47th minute of Argentina's 1–0 quarter-final victory against [[Peru national under-17 football team|Peru]], setting up a semi-final match against [[Colombia national under-17 football team|Colombia]] which Argentina lost 2–0.
Agüero represented Argentina at two [[FIFA U-20 World Cup|FIFA World Youth Championships]], winning back-to-back world titles. He was part of the team that won the [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship|2005 edition]] in the Netherlands, alongside his future 2008 Olympics squad teammates [[Fernando Gago]] and [[Lionel Messi]]. At the [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup]], held in Canada, Agüero scored twice and helped set up three goals in a 6–0 win over [[Panama national under-20 football team|Panama]] in the second game of the group stage of the tournament. He then scored the only goal in Argentina's third match against [[North Korea national under-20 football team|North Korea]] from a free kick. Having qualified to the round of 16, he scored two of the three goals against [[Poland national under-20 football team|Poland]] that would eventually give them a [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup#Round of 16|3–1]] win to advance to the next round. Argentina defeated [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico]] in the quarter-finals and [[Chile national under-20 football team|Chile]] in the semi-finals, and faced the [[Czech Republic national under-20 football team|Czech Republic]] in the finals, a team they drew [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup#Group E|0–0]] in the group stage. Agüero captained and scored the equaliser in the 62nd minute, leading to a [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup#Final|2–1]] victory. In addition, Agüero won the Golden Boot of the tournament, scoring six goals in seven, and the Golden Ball as the best player of the tournament.
As a member of the Argentine squad for the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2008 Beijing Olympics]], Agüero scored two goals in the space of five minutes in the semi-final [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament#Semi-finals|3–0]] win over [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil]] on 19 August 2008.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Harris |first1=Nick |title=Argentina 3 Brazil 0: Argentina in final after routing arch rivals |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/olympics/argentina-3-brazil-0-argentina-in-final-after-routing-arch-rivals-902777.html |accessdate=25 October 2015 |work=The Independent |date=20 August 2008}}</ref> Argentina went on to win its second consecutive gold medal at the Olympic tournament.
===Senior team=== ====Debut, 2010 World Cup and 2011 Copa América==== At age 18, Agüero made his senior debut for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] in a friendly with [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]], played at [[Emirates Stadium]], England on 3 September 2006.<ref name="Official"/><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player=228528/profile-detail.html |title=Sergio AGUERO |accessdate=22 June 2014 |work=FIFA}}</ref> A year later, he scored his first international goal in a [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2010 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]], and went on to score three more times as the ''Albiceleste'' successfully qualified for the finals in [[South Africa]].
[[File:Sergio Agüero (L), Ricardo Rodriguez (C), Valentin Stocker (R) - Switzerland vs. Argentina, 29th February 2012.jpg|thumb|Agüero taking on two Swiss players in an international friendly in 2012]]
Agüero was chosen for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] squad, and made his [[FIFA World Cup]] debut in Argentina's second group match against [[Korea Republic national football team|South Korea]] on 12 June 2010, replacing [[Carlos Tevez]] in the 75th minute. Agüero's impact was immediate as Argentina scored in the next minute. He assisted on [[Gonzalo Higuaín]]'s hat-trick goal late in the game. Argentina won the game [[2010 FIFA World Cup Group B#Argentina vs Korea Republic|4–1]]. Argentina, however, subsequently lost to [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Argentina vs Germany|quarter-finals]].
Agüero was named in the 23-man squad for the [[2011 Copa América]] where Argentina had been drawn into Group A with [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]], [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]], and [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]]. On 1 July, in Argentina's opening [[2011 Copa América Group A|group stage]] match against Bolivia, he came on for [[Ezequiel Lavezzi]] on 71 minutes and scored an equaliser on 76 minutes to secure a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/3710/copa-america/2011/07/02/2557071/super-sub-sergio-aguero-rescues-argentina-as-lavezzi-tevez-messi- |title=Super-sub Sergio Aguero rescues Argentina as Lavezzi, Tevez & Messi combination fails to ignite |publisher=Goal.com |date=2 July 2011 |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://df1.conmebol.com/copaamerica/fichas/ficha99064.html |title=Ficha del partido |publisher=Df1.conmebol.com |date= |accessdate=24 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110802192352/http://df1.conmebol.com/copaamerica/fichas/ficha99064.html |archivedate=2 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,,11065_3368824,00.html |title=Match Report | Argentina v Bolivia – 2 July 2011 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 July 2011 |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref> On 11 July, in Argentina's third group stage match against Costa Rica, Agüero scored a goal in each half as Argentina won 3–0 and finished in second position in their group.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://df1.conmebol.com/copaamerica/fichas/ficha99069.html |title=Ficha del partido |publisher=Df1.conmebol.com |date= |accessdate=24 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110814154748/http://df1.conmebol.com/copaamerica/fichas/ficha99069.html |archivedate=14 August 2011}}</ref>
====2014 World Cup, and 2015 and 2016 Copas América==== Agüero was named in Argentina's 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2014: Ever Banega excluded from Argentina squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27403312 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 June 2014}}</ref> On 15 June, he started alongside Lionel Messi as a forward in Argentina's 2–1 win against [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] at the [[Estádio do Maracanã]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25285099 |title=Argentina 2–1 Bos-Herze |date=16 June 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |last=Sanghera |first=Mandeep}}</ref>
Agüero was named in the Argentine squad for the [[2015 Copa América]], and in a warm-up game on 7 June against Bolivia in [[San Juan, Argentina|San Juan]], he scored his first international hat-trick in a 5–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sergio Aguero and Angel Di Maria score in Argentina win over Bolivia |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33039786 |accessdate=7 June 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 June 2015}}</ref> On 13 June, he scored Argentina's opening goal of the tournament in a 2–2 [[2015 Copa América Group B|group stage]] draw with [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33081605 |title=Argentina 2–2 Paraguay |date=14 June 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 October 2015}}</ref> Three days later at the same ground, he headed a cross from Manchester City teammate [[Pablo Zabaleta]] for a 1–0 win against holders [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33085567 |title=Argentina 1–0 Uruguay |date=17 June 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 October 2015 |last=Fletcher |first=Paul}}</ref> At the semi-final stage, Agüero headed in [[Ángel Di María]]'s cross as Argentina defeated Paraguay 6–1 to reach the [[2015 Copa América Final]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33085956 |title=Argentina 6–1 Paraguay |date=1 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 October 2015 |last=Emons |first=Michael}}</ref> Agüero started the final against [[Chile national football team|Chile]], but was replaced in the 74th minute for Gonzalo Higuaín in an eventual penalty shootout loss.<ref>{{cite news |title=Copa America: Man City trio suffer defeat with Argentina as Aguero sub backfires |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/copa-america-man-city-trio-9589226 |accessdate=8 August 2015 |work=Manchester Evening News |first=Samuel |last=Luckhurst |date=5 July 2015}}</ref>
Agüero was included in [[Gerardo Martino]]'s 23-man squad for the [[Copa América Centenario]] and scored his first goal of the tournament in Argentina's second group match, a 5–0 win over [[Panama national football team|Panama]] on 10 June 2016, which allowed them to advance to the quarter-finals of the competition.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jun/10/lionel-messi-hat-trick-argentina-panama-copa-america |title=Lionel Messi scores brilliant hat-trick as Argentina surge into quarter-finals |work=The Guardian |date=11 June 2016 |accessdate=11 June 2016}}</ref> Agüero considered retiring from international football shortly after losing against [[Chile national football team|Chile]] in a penalty shootout in the [[Copa América Centenario Final|final]] of the tournament for a second consecutive time.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/587/copa-america/2016/06/27/25093862/aguero-several-players-evaluating-not-continuing-with |title=Aguero: Several players evaluating not continuing with Argentina |publisher=''Goal.com'' |date=27 June 2016}}</ref>
====2018 World Cup==== On 14 November 2017, Agüero was taken to hospital after fainting in the dressing room at half-time in a 4–2 loss to [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] in a friendly match in [[Krasnodar]], [[Russia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41991262 |title=Sergio Aguero: Argentina striker taken to hospital after fainting in the dressing room at half-time |date=14 November 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=14 November 2017}}</ref>
In May 2018, Agüero was named in Argentina's preliminary 35-man [[Argentina national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in [[Russia]];<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb |title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced? |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=17 June 2018}}</ref> later that month, he was included in [[Jorge Sampaoli]]'s final 23-man squad for the competition.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/argentina-world-cup-squad-paulo-dybala-mauro-icardi-a8362096.html |title=Argentina World Cup squad: Paulo Dybala included but Mauro Icardi misses out on 23-man group for Russia |publisher=The Independent |date=21 May 2018 |accessdate=17 June 2018}}</ref> In his team's first group match of the tournament against [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] on 16 June, he scored the opening goal of an eventual 1–1 draw; this was his first ever World Cup goal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/jun/16/argentina-v-iceland-world-cup-2018-live |title=Argentina 1-1 Iceland |publisher=The Guardian |author1=Rob Smyth |date=16 June 2018 |accessdate=17 June 2018}}</ref> In the round of 16 match against [[France national football team|France]] on 30 June, Agüero scored Argentina's final goal in a 4–3 defeat, which saw his side eliminated from the World Cup.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/43976007 |title=France 4-3 Argentina |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Emlyn Begley |date=30 June 2018 |accessdate=30 June 2018}}</ref>

Telegraph |date=28 July 2011 |location=London}}</ref> due to his passing ability, tactical intelligence, and vision, which made him a capable assist-man.<ref name="Aguero, classe da vendere">{{cite web |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Primo_Piano/2007/07_Luglio/13/aguero.shtml |title=Aguero, classe da vendere |publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport |language=Italian |author1=Stefano Cantalupi ==Personal life== [[File:Sergio Agüero 2011-09-08 001.jpg|thumb|Publicity photo for [[Puma AG]], September 2011]] Agüero was married to Gianinna Maradona, the youngest daughter of Argentine footballer [[Diego Maradona]]. On 19 February 2009, Gianinna gave birth to their son, Benjamín, in [[Madrid]]. Diego Maradona was there for the birth of his first grandson, while Agüero, then 20, missed Atlético's training session earlier in the day. Atlético offered their congratulations in a statement on their official website.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2009/02/19/soccer-maradona-idUKLJ7605820090219 |title=Maradona a grandfather thanks to Atletico's Aguero |date=19 February 2009 |publisher=Reuters |accessdate=30 October 2015 |last=Elkington |first=Mark}}</ref> Agüero and Gianinna separated in 2012 after four years together.<ref>{{cite news |first=Todd |last=Fitzgerald |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/greater-manchester-news/manchester-citys-sergio-aguero-splits-1209630 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |title=Manchester City's Sergio Aguero splits from wife of four years |date=4 January 2013 |accessdate=28 March 2015}}</ref>
Agüero's nickname "Kun", which features on his shirt, dates back to his childhood. It was first given to him by his grandparents,<ref>{{cite web |work=Daily Mail |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2027348/Sergio-Aguero-use-Kun-Manchester-City-shirt.html |title=Yes you Kun! New City star Aguero told he can use nickname on his shirt |date=18 August 2011 |accessdate=30 October 2015}}</ref> due to a resemblance to the character "[[Kum-Kum]]" from the anime [[Wanpaku Omukashi Kumu Kumu]] which was Agüero's favourite television programme as a child.<ref name="kun" /> He stated, "I have grown to appreciate it because it's unique. It's not every day an athlete is nicknamed after a cartoon character!"<ref name="kun">{{cite news |publisher=BBC Sport |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7384547.stm |title=The rise of Sergio Aguero |date=7 May 2008 |accessdate=30 October 2015}}</ref> Agüero has a tattoo on the inside of his right arm inscribed in [[Tengwar]]—a form of writing invented by [[J. R. R. Tolkien]] in ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''—that transliterates roughly to ''Kun Agüero'' in the [[Latin script]]. He also has a tattoo on his left arm of his son's name and date of birth.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.vanishingtattoo.com/tattoo/celeb-aguero.htm |title=Sergio Agüero Tattoos |publisher=Vanishing Tattoo |accessdate=5 June 2009}}</ref> Agüero holds [[Spanish nationality law|Spanish nationality]], after being granted citizenship in 2010 whilst playing for [[Atlético Madrid]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11838/6551790/aguero-gains-eu-status |title=Aguero gains EU status |publisher=Sky Sports |date=3 December 2010 |accessdate=30 October 2015}}</ref>
Agüero shares a close friendship with [[Lionel Messi]], his regular roommate during outings for the national team since 2005. He described Messi as being "like a brother" in his 2014 autobiography, ''Born to Rise'', which contains a foreword written by Messi.<ref>{{cite web |last=Smith |first=Ben |publisher=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29962472 |title=Sergio Aguero: Man City hero's journey from the 'cave of vipers' |date=8 November 2014 |accessdate=30 October 2015}}</ref> Messi is the godfather of Aguero's son Benjamin.<ref>{{cite web |last=Maston |first=Tom |publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]] |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/4160/extra-time/2012/11/13/3525665/extra-time-aguero-delivers-gift-for-thiago-messi |title=Extra Time: Aguero delivers gift for Thiago Messi |accessdate=12 October 2018}}</ref>
[[Gastón del Castillo]] and [[Mauricio del Castillo]] are brothers of Agüero.<ref name="Brothers">{{cite news |title=Aguero spotted watching brother Mauricio del Castillo's debut |url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/international-football/2016/09/03/57cb2600ca47419f308b45ad.html |accessdate=16 March 2018 |work=Marca |date=3 September 2016}}</ref>
